intro: Madlabium, commonly known as the desert lily, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees with thick, fleshy stems adapted to store water. Their leaves are often reduced to spines, minimizing water loss through transpiration. The flowers are showy, usually white or yellow, and bloom in the spring. Madlabium species are valued for their resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
